definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture
younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)

sentences.english: 'My dear cousin,I don't eat that kind of food in my house.
sentences.chinese: 我的親愛的堂兄弟，我在我的房子裏不喫那種食品。

sentences.english: Uncles, aunts and cousins will come.
sentences.chinese: 叔叔，姑母和堂兄弟將要來。

sentences.english: Or so our cousins across the Channel like to have it.
sentences.chinese: 也許海峽對岸的我們的堂兄弟會喜歡這樣。

sentences.english: This group aims at uniting all Yan Yee Tong brothers together.
sentences.chinese: 本聯盟旨在團結所有仁義堂兄弟。

sentences.english: They are cousins of "Queen Bee" Dia and Uday.
sentences.chinese: 女王蜂直徑和烏代，他們是堂兄弟。

sentences.english: Lucy has more uncles and aunts so she has more cousins.
sentences.chinese: 露西有許多叔伯姨姑，所以她有許多堂兄弟姐妹。

sentences.english: Eugenie clasped her cousin's hand tightly in hers when she heard these last words.
sentences.chinese: 歐也妮聽到最後一句，不禁顫危危地握着堂兄弟的手。

sentences.english: Tom pm'ked out his cousins from the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆從人羣中認出了他的堂兄弟。

sentences.english: Because you’re more likely to believe that rumor forwarded by cousin Rob.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你更容易相信堂兄弟羅伯給你發送的謠言。

sentences.english: The Duke of Aosta was a cousin of the King of Italy.
sentences.chinese: 阿奧斯塔公爵是意大利國王的堂兄弟。

sentences.english: I got me a cousin in Sioux Falls.
sentences.chinese: 我有個堂兄弟在蘇福斯。

definition: (of cousins) descending from the same grandfather or great-grandfather
older male cousin via female line
collateral relative (descended from a common ancestor but through different lines)
